Art is everywhere that the Artist goes.

Yves Klein was a French artist and an important figure in post-war European art.
He was a leading member of the French artistic movement of Nouveau r√©alisme founded in 1960 by art critic Pierre Restany.
Klein was a pioneer in the development of performance art, and is seen as an inspiration to and as a forerunner of minimal art, as well as pop art.

Official Website

International Klein Blue

The colour of the sea.
International Klein Blue (IKB) is a deep blue hue first mixed by the French artist Yves Klein. IKB's visual impact comes from its heavy reliance on ultramarine, as well as Klein's often thick and textured application of paint to canvas.

Fire Paitings, Cosmogonies, Immaterial...

The work. of Klein is extensive and peculiar. Famous not only for the paintings, but also the performance process trough wich they where created, Yves Klein took care of every detain in his peculiar way. Probably the most known concept is the "Human Brushes Painting", where a model covered in paint was directed by Klein in a coreography painting the canvas with her own body.

His most famous painting collection, the "Antropomethries" is a series of paintings performed applying the human brushes painting technique on canvas of different dimension.
